channel.title: Port forwarding issue
channel.description: Okay so here's what I have done: 1) I turned off my firewall just in case it was on the way. 2) made a static ip address for my router so that it does'nt change. 3) I connected with my router and port forwarded the port 43594 (667/711) server. 4) I used TCP port opener program that I downloaded from CNET. 5) I opened the port 43594 in it. 6) I went to canyouseeme.com and checked if the port was open, and it gave me a positive result meaning it was open. 7) I downloaded no-ip, logged in and put a check mark beside the host and it showed that it is running. 8) I ran the server files on that pc. 9) I then changed the ip in loader.java and client.java to that from no-ip 10) I tested the server on another pc with a totally different router, but the client is stuck at 1%. Although it showed in the TCP port opener that my pc is trying to connect with the other pc. Anyone got any idea how I might fix that problem and run the client? Thank you for you cooperation :)

i may have a similar issue, how did you resolve it?

item.title: Port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

Portforward with a router, problem solved.

It’s these kind of programs that you won’t be able to connect to the server.
Im sorry its the truth, you can use another pc (different ip) to connect to your server though. I would not recommend it but you can do it

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @ChatX2012 ChatX2012
item.description:
@ChatX2012 wrote:

Okay so here’s what I have done:

  1. I turned off my firewall just in case it was on the way.
  2. made a static ip address for my router so that it does’nt change.
  3. I connected with my router and port forwarded the port 43594 (667/711) server.
  4. I used TCP port opener program that I downloaded from CNET.
  5. I opened the port 43594 in it.
  6. I went to canyouseeme.com and checked if the port was open, and it gave me a positive result meaning it was open.
  7. I downloaded no-ip, logged in and put a check mark beside the host and it showed that it is running.
  8. I ran the server files on that pc.
  9. I then changed the ip in loader.java and client.java to that from no-ip
  10. I tested the server on another pc with a totally different router, but the client is stuck at 1%.
    Although it showed in the TCP port opener that my pc is trying to connect with the other pc.
    Anyone got any idea how I might fix that problem and run the client?
    Thank you for you cooperation

Read full topic
